"If I reach out my phone to play something during training he'll yell at me," he said. "He never shies away from hard work. He never finds excuses," he added.

174.title: Uproot inferiority complex to achieve true independence: Amit Shah
174.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said Indians must uproot the 'inferiority complex' within themselves to achieve 'true independence'. Speaking ahead of India's 76th Independence Day celebrations, Shah said foreign powers ruled India as they succeeded in making native citizens believe they were inferior. "The country that gave Geeta and the Vedas...how can it be illiterate," he asked.

175.title: France going through its most severe drought ever, says PM Borne
175.article_body: France is facing the "most severe drought" ever recorded in the country, French Prime Minister Élisabeth Borne warned in a statement on Friday. Many areas in France are going through a "historic situation" as the country endures its third heatwave this summer, she said. Borne announced the activation of a government crisis unit due to the situation.

176.title: Congress workers and police clash outside Raj Bhawan in Ranchi
176.article_body: A clash broke out between Congress workers and police personnel in Ranchi as several party workers forced their way to Raj Bhawan during their protest march against inflation on Friday. "The Congress workers had permission only to march till Zakir Hussain Park," an official said. "But they pulled down the barricades and reached Raj Bhawan gates," he added.

177.title: Chandigarh Police arrests gangster absconding for last 3 years
177.article_body: Chandigarh Police has arrested an absconding gangster wanted for murder and other cases by the Haryana and UP Police. The accused, Vinit Gahlot, alias Vicky Mitrau, had been absconding for the past three years, police said. Gahlot belongs to the Manjeet Mahal gang and his elder brother Ashok is also a gangster and is presently lodged in jail, police added.

178.title: Snickers maker apologises to China for ad suggesting Taiwan is a country
178.article_body: Mars Wrigley, makers of the Snickers candy bar, apologised for a Snickers product launch which allegedly called Taiwan a country. Videos and pictures of an event promoting a Snickers bar that was said to be only available in the countries of South Korea, Malaysia and Taiwan went viral. Mars Wrigley later said the relevant content had been amended.

179.title: 88% dip in law & order incidents in Kashmir since Aug 2019: Police
179.article_body: Kashmir recorded a decrease of over 88% in law and order incidents in the three years since the erstwhile state's special status was revoked on August 5, 2019, compared to the preceding three years, police said. The Valley saw 3,686 law and order incidents from 2016 to 2019. In three years from August 5, 2019, the Valley recorded 438 incidents.

180.title: Bollywood needs to pull up their socks: Sonu Sood
180.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood has said that South filmmakers have always focused on bringing the audience to the theatres with their extravagant films. When asked if Bollywood needs to pull up their socks, he said, "They need to, I mean everyone needs to...as I think, when you have competition...that's the time you will excel."

181.title: Punjab Governor Banwarilal Purohit tests positive for COVID-19
181.article_body: As per an official statement, Punjab Governor and Administrator of Chandigarh Banwarilal Purohit has tested positive for COVID-19. Purohit is not showing any serious symptoms, the statement said. All those who came in contact with him are requested to isolate, it added. Purohit had also tested positive for the virus in 2020 while he was the Governor of Tamil Nadu.

182.title: Indian wrestler Bajrang Punia wins his 2nd consecutive gold medal at CWG
182.article_body: Indian wrestler Bajrang Punia on Friday bagged his second consecutive gold medal at CWG. The 28-year-old defeated Canada's Lachlan McNeil in the final of the men's freestyle 65 kg category at CWG 2022. Bajrang had defeated Wales' Kane Charig in the final at CWG 2018 to bag his first CWG gold. Bajrang had won a silver medal at CWG 2014.

183.title: Won't pretend to be Shah Rukh Khan's Raj: DDLJ musical's Austin Colby
183.article_body: British actor Austin Colby, who'll play the character based on Shah Rukh Khan's Raj in Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge's Broadway musical adaptation, has responded to criticism around his casting. "I'm aware what my involvement in this production means to...people. I'm not...Raj that Shah Rukh Khan made us fall in love with, nor will I ever pretend to be," Austin said.

184.title: We were detained in undemocratic way, it's not a good sign: Sachin Pilot
184.article_body: Sachin Pilot, along with other Congress leaders, including Priyanka and Rahul Gandhi, was detained in Delhi on Friday for holding protests against inflation and unemployment. On being released after six hours, Pilot said, "The way we're detained in an undemocratic way isn't a good sign." "By fixing the accountability of government, it's our responsibility to question them," he added.

185.title: Indian table tennis player Sathiyan enters men's singles pre-quarters at CWG
185.article_body: Indian paddler Sathiyan Gnanasekaran beat Paul McCreery of Northern Ireland to enter men's singles pre-quarterfinal at Commonwealth Games 2022. Sathiyan won with a scoreline of 11-9, 11-9, 12-10, 13-11 in the round of 32. Meanwhile, Sathiyan and mixed doubles partner Manika Batra lost in the mixed doubles quarter-final. Malaysia's Choong Javen and Lyne Karen defeated the Indian team 3-2.

186.title: Lost jewels found in remains of Spanish ship that sank over 350 years ago
186.article_body: Jewel-encrusted pendants and gold chains are among the priceless artefacts that were found among the remains of a Spanish ship which sank over 350 years ago in the Bahamas. The lost treasure was found recently by Bahamian and US marine archaeologists and divers. They were found among a debris trail spanning over 13 km near the Little Bahama Bank.

187.title: Ashwin-Chahal complement each other; don't see Kuldeep coming in: Sanjay
187.article_body: Former player Sanjay Manjrekar has commented on the combination of spinners Ravichandran Ashwin and Yuzvendra Chahal. "Ashwin focused...on the economy, but when you have...Chahal...then Ashwin becomes a great complement because he has mastered the art of being economical in T20 cricket," Manjrekar said. He added that the combination of Chahal and Kuldeep Yadav will never be "employed" again.

188.title: Lightning strike near White House leaves 2 dead and 2 injured
188.article_body: Two people were killed and two others were injured in a lightning strike in Lafayette Square near the White House, police said on Friday. The lightning struck them on Thursday near a tree that stands yards away from the fence that surrounds the White House, according to Reuters. A thunderstorm had swept through Washington DC earlier in the day.

189.title: 21-year-old Anshu Malik wins silver, India's 1st medal in wrestling at CWG 2022
189.article_body: Wrestler Anshu Malik bagged India's first wrestling medal at the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022 after clinching silver following her defeat to two-time CWG gold medallist Odunayo Folasade Adekuoroye in the women's freestyle 57 kg event. The 21-year-old was featuring in her first-ever CWG. Anshu had beaten Sri Lanka's Nethmi Poruthotage in the semi-final of the event.

190.title: Russian President Putin hosts Turkish counterpart Erdogan in Sochi
190.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin hosted his Turkish counterpart Recep Erdogan in Sochi on Friday. The war in Ukraine and the situation in Syria were said to be on the agenda. This is the second meeting between the leaders since Turkey supported an agreement between Russia and Ukraine last month to provide a safe sea route to ship trapped grain stocks.

191.title: South Africa reports 1st death causally linked to COVID-19 vaccine
191.article_body: South Africa's health regulator on Thursday said that a causal link has been established between the death of an individual due to neurological disorder Guillain-Barre Syndrome (GBS) and Johnson & Johnson's COVID-19 vaccine. The person developed GBS shortly after taking the vaccine, senior scientists informed. "At the time of illness, no other cause for GBS could be identified," they said.

192.title: J&K logs 823 fresh COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths reported
192.article_body: Jammu & Kashmir reported 823 new cases of COVID-19 on Friday, taking the union territory's active case count to 5,133, officials informed. The union territory also recorded two fatalities due to the infection. According to officials, Jammu division logged 190 cases on Friday, whereas 633 cases were reported from the Kashmir valley.

193.title: Congress protesting in black clothes an insult to Ram Bhakts: UP CM Yogi
193.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath criticised Congress for protesting against the government in black clothes on Ayodhya Diwas and said, "It's an insult to...the Ram Bhakts." He said, "Until now, Congress was protesting in normal attire, but today they protested wearing black clothes...They chose this day [Ayodhya Diwas] which marks the beginning of the construction of Ram Janambhoomi."

194.title: 1 dead, 14 injured after grenade attack in Balochistan's Quetta
194.article_body: A grenade attack on Thursday night in the Balochistan province of Pakistan left at least one person dead and 14 others injured, local media reported on Friday. The incident reportedly occurred when unidentified motorcyclists hurled a grenade at roadside stalls in Quetta's Joint road area. No militant group has claimed responsibility for the attack so far, media reports said.

195.title: Rahul, other Congress leaders released after 6-hr detention in Delhi
195.article_body: Congress leaders including Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi, Shashi Tharoor and KC Venugopal were released from a police station in Delhi after being detained for almost six hours on Friday. They had been detained under Delhi Police Act while protesting against inflation, GST and unemployment. "[We have] been released after being detained...for protesting peacefully," Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said.

196.title: Indian men's team reaches final of 4x400m relay event at CWG 2022
196.article_body: Indian men's relay team of Muhammed Anas Yahiya, Noah Nirmal Tom, Muhammed Ajmal Variyathodi and Amoj Jacob qualified for the 4x400 metres final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Friday. The Indian team finished second in heat two, clocking 3:06.97. Kenya topped the heat, with a timing of 3:06.76. The final will be held on Sunday.

197.title: Israel launches air strikes in Gaza, 5-year-old girl among 7 killed
197.article_body: Israel on Friday said it has launched airstrikes on Gaza, which reportedly killed at least seven people and injured another 40, following heightened tensions in the occupied West Bank. A five-year-old girl was among those killed in the strike, the Palestinian Health Ministry said. An Islamic Jihad group militant named Tayseer Jabari was also among those killed, Israel confirmed.

198.title: Nadal withdraws from Montreal tennis event due to abdominal strain
198.article_body: Former world number one Rafael Nadal has withdrawn from next week's ATP 1000 event in Montreal, Canada due to an ongoing abdominal strain. "I am very sad not to...play a tournament that I have won five times," the 36-year-old Spaniard said. Notably, the same injury forced the 22-time Grand Slam champion to miss his Wimbledon semi-final last month.

199.title: Congress' 'black protest' subtle message against Ram Mandir's construction: Shah
199.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday questioned the choice of Congress leaders to wear black clothes during their protests on the anniversary of PM Narendra Modi laying the foundation stone of Ram Mandir. Shah claimed that the move was a subtle way of conveying Congress' opposition to temple's construction. This was done "to further promote their appeasement politics", he added.

200.title: PV Sindhu reaches her 3rd consecutive women's singles quarters at CWG
200.article_body: Two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu reached her third consecutive women's singles quarter-final at the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham on Friday. The 27-year-old Indian shuttler defeated Uganda's Husina Kobugabe 21-10, 21-9 in the round of 16. Sindhu, the last edition's silver medallist in the singles, will face Malaysia's Goh Jin Wei in the quarter-final on Saturday.

201.title: 6 countries interested in buying India's Tejas fighter jets, govt releases list
201.article_body: The government on Friday said that state-owned Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) has offered to sell 18 Tejas fighter jets to Malaysia, adding that six other nations are interested in buying them. Argentina, Australia, Egypt, the United States of America, Indonesia and the Philippines have expressed an interest in buying the light-combat aircraft (LCA), the Defence Ministry said.

202.title: Took dictionary to censor board to explain ch****a isn't gaali: Anurag on Satya
202.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap revealed that he carried a Hindi dictionary to explain a word to the censor board when his 1998 film 'Satya' went for screening. He shared a video that explained how the word 'ch****a' isn't an abusive term, writing, "That's a major truth. During...censor screening of SATYA, I carried...Hindi dictionary to explain the same...that ch****a isn't a gaali."

203.title: Anupam meets Rajamouli in Hyderabad, actor says 'love your simplicity'
203.article_body: Veteran actor Anupam Kher recently met SS Rajamouli and his wife Rama Rajamouli at their residence in Hyderabad. He took to Instagram to thank the 'RRR' director for hosting him for lunch at his place. Anupam also shared a video where he could be seen wrapping a traditional shawl around Rajamouli's shoulders. "I love your simplicity and humility," Anupam wrote.

204.title: Former Pakistan minister spits on live TV during debate, video goes viral
204.article_body: Former Pakistan minister Sheikh Rasheed Ahmad spat during a live television debate, the footage of which has gone viral. This came after Ahmad was asked a question about the current Interior Minister of Pakistan Rana Sanaullah. "His new portfolio should be: minister for spitting on live TV," wrote journalist Naila Inayat while sharing the video.

205.title: Raped by father, 13-yr-old girl delivers baby in Tamil Nadu's Vellore
205.article_body: A 44-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping and impregnating his 13-year-old daughter in Tamil Nadu's Vellore district. The matter came to light when the minor complained about stomach ache and was taken to a government hospital. Upon questioning, the girl told police that she had been repeatedly raped by her father for the past 10 months.

206.title: Flash floods killed 550 in Pakistan over past month: Govt agency
206.article_body: Pakistan's National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) on Friday said that flash floods caused by abnormally heavy monsoon rains killed at least 550 people in the country over the past month. The floods had damaged more than 46,200 houses, it added. "We're doing our best to provide for extensive relief and rehabilitation of flood victims," Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif said.

207.title: National-record holder Jyothi fails to qualify for 100m hurdles final at CWG
207.article_body: India's Jyothi Yarraji failed to qualify for the women's 100 metres hurdles final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Friday. The 22-year-old clocked 13.18 seconds to finish fourth in heat two. Jamaica's Megan Tapper topped the heat, clocking 12.68 seconds. Notably, Jyothi is the national record-holder. She clocked 13.04 seconds to set the record.

208.title: South Korea launches its first lunar orbiter
208.article_body: South Korea launched its first lunar orbiter, Korea Pathfinder Lunar Orbiter, nicknamed Danuri, on Friday. The orbiter was launched on SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket from Florida's Cape Canaveral Space Force Station. It is expected to enter the moon's orbit in December and start a year-long observation mission to search for possible landing sites, conduct research on the lunar environment etc.

209.title: Hoping best players play international cricket as often as they can: ICC CEO
209.article_body: ICC CEO Geoff Allardice said he hopes that the best cricketers often play international cricket. "There'll still be all-format players...whether they play every match...is a different question," Geoff said. He added, "The balance of players playing international cricket versus domestic leagues will continue to evolve." Recently, Ben Stokes retired from ODIs citing an "unsustainable" schedule.

210.title: Ex-Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, Arpita sent to jail for 14 days
210.article_body: A Kolkata court on Friday sent former Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee to a 14-day judicial custody in connection with the West Bengal teacher recruitment scam case. The two will remain in jail till August 18. The Enforcement Directorate's lawyer told the court that the agency needs to interrogate them over new findings in the case.

211.title: Husbands take oath as wives elected to panchayat in MP, probe ordered
211.article_body: A Scheduled Caste woman was recently elected as Sarpanch after elections at Madhya Pradesh's Gaisabad Panchayat, Damoh. Some other women were also elected as panchayat members. A video showed that instead of the women, their husbands and other male relatives allegedly took oath in the swearing-in ceremony. Zila Panchayat CEO Ajay Shrivastava ordered an enquiry after the video went viral.

212.title: I was suicidal at times: Deepika Padukone on battling depression
212.article_body: Deepika Padukone recently talked about the time when she was battling depression. Speaking at an event, she said, "I would break down for no reason...I would sleep because sleep for me was an escape. I was suicidal at times." "Even now when my parents visit me, I always put on a brave front that everything's okay," she added.

213.title: Over 300, including 65 MPs, detained during Congress protest in Delhi
213.article_body: Around 335 people, including 65 Members of Parliament (MPs) were detained in Delhi on Friday, amid Congress' protest against price rise and GST. The detentions were made under the Delhi Police Act, police said, adding, "Intimation about detention...is being sent to the respective competent authorities." Rahul Gandhi, Shashi Tharoor and Priyanka Vadra were among those detained.

214.title: Indian wrestler Bajrang Punia reaches his 3rd final in a row at CWG
214.article_body: Olympic bronze medal-winning Indian wrestler Bajrang Punia has reached his third final in a row in CWG history. The 28-year-old, who bagged silver medal at CWG 2014 and a gold medal at CWG 2018, defeated England's George Ramm in the men's freestyle 65 kg category semi-final at CWG 2022. His gold medal bout will take place later tonight.

215.title: Why is BJP so scared of gas cylinders if there is no inflation: Priyanka
215.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi has criticised the BJP government over the alleged rising inflation. "The...government which charges tax on flour, milk...claims that there is no inflation. Then why is BJP so scared after seeing gas cylinders?" Priyanka said. She added, "Arresting us won't hide the truth as the cylinder which cost ₹410 in 2014 is now priced at ₹1100."

216.title: Sakshi Malik confirms her third CWG medal, to fight for gold tonight
216.article_body: Indian wrestler Sakshi Malik defeated Cameroon's Berthe Emilienne Etane Ngolle in semi-final to reach the final of the women's freestyle 62 kg event at CWG 2022. With this, Sakshi assured herself of her third medal in CWG history. She had bagged silver at CWG 2014 and bronze at CWG 2018. Her gold medal bout will take place later tonight.

217.title: 21-year-old Indian wrestler Anshu Malik reaches gold medal bout on her CWG debut
217.article_body: India's 21-year-old wrestler Anshu Malik has reached the gold medal bout in the women's freestyle 57 kg category on her CWG debut. Anshu defeated Sri Lanka's Nethmi Poruthotage to reach the final. In 2021, Anshu had become the first Indian female wrestler to win silver medal at the World Championships.

218.title: Bird hits Vistara Varanasi-Mumbai flight forcing it to turn around, plane grounded
218.article_body: A Vistara Varanasi-Mumbai flight had to turn around due to a bird hit, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said on Friday. The UK622 flight, however, made a safe landing in Varanasi, although its radome is damaged, DGCA added. The A320 aircraft has been declared Aircraft on Ground (AOG) on account of the damage.

219.title: It was not for KBC: Amitabh on his 'each time I say never again' post
219.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan has clarified his recent note, 'each time I say never again and yet it all comes back when the commitment has been made', wasn't for his show 'KBC'. "It was for...hair that gets stuck to my face for...films' makeup, and I swear...[I'll] never...do...film with hair stuck to my chin, moustache and yet end up doing it," he added.

220.title: Amazon to acquire robot vacuum cleaner maker iRobot for $1.7 billion
220.article_body: Amazon on Friday said it has signed an agreement to acquire Roomba robot vacuum maker iRobot. The e-commerce giant said it will acquire iRobot for $61 per share in an all-cash transaction valued at approximately $1.7 billion, including iRobot's net debt. On completion of the deal, Colin Angle will remain as CEO of iRobot, Amazon said.

221.title: What an amazing actor, respect: Hrithik on Deepak's performance in 'Good...'
221.article_body: Hrithik Roshan took to Twitter on Thursday to praise Deepak Dobriyal's performance in the recently released movie 'Good Luck Jerry'. "What an amazing actor. Brilliant comic timing and screen presence. Respect," he wrote. Deepak re-shared Hrithik's post on his Instagram handle, writing, "Hrithik Bhai made my decade." 'Good Luck Jerry' also featured Janhvi Kapoor.

222.title: 27-yr-old woman from Kolkata allegedly raped in Noida: Police
222.article_body: A 27-year-old woman from Kolkata was allegedly raped by a man in a hotel in Noida, the police said on Friday. The accused had befriended the victim in a club in Gurugram's Sector 29, the police added. The victim claimed that the accused had threatened to kill her if she disclosed the incident.

223.title: 15,000 litres of liquor seized from Apr-July in GB Nagar: Official
223.article_body: The excise department in Gautam Buddha Nagar seized nearly 15,000 litres of smuggled liquor between April 1 and July 31 this year, a senior official said. The official also said that 164 people were arrested for smuggling the liquor during the same period. Notably, 6,577 litres of liquor was seized during the same period last year.

224.title: Kannada actor, comedian Tennis Krishna enters politics, joins AAP
224.article_body: Kannada actor and comedian Tennis Krishna started his political career by joining the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Thursday. The former tennis coach joined AAP at an event in Bengaluru in the presence of AAP Karnataka Convenor Prithvi Reddy and other leaders. The Twitter page of AAP Bengaluru congratulated him, tweeting, "Hearty welcome." Krishna has acted in around 600 movies.

225.title: 3 corn-laden ships leave Ukraine under grain deal with Russia
225.article_body: Three more ships under the grain export deal signed by Ukraine and Russia departed from Ukrainian ports on Friday, officials confirmed. With over 58,000 tons of corn, the ships are bound for Ireland, the UK and Turkey. The first Ukrainian ship that set sail under the deal earlier this week passed inspection in Istanbul on Wednesday and left for Lebanon.

226.title: Indian shuttler Kidambi reaches men's singles quarter-final at CWG 2022
226.article_body: Indian shuttler Kidambi Srikanth entered the men's singles quarter-final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Friday. The 29-year-old defeated Dumindu Abeywickrama of Sri Lanka 21-9, 21-12 in the round of 16. Srikanth will face England's Toby Penty in the quarter-final on Saturday. Penty beat Scotland's Callum Smith 25-23, 21-12 in the round of 16.

227.title: Man arrested for smuggling foreign cash in thread rolls at Delhi airport
227.article_body: An Indian man was arrested at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) airport on Thursday for allegedly trying to smuggle out foreign currency worth ₹42.25 lakhs by concealing it in plastic thread rolls. The accused, who was travelling to Dubai, tied the money around the rolls with black scotch tape, officials said. The officials intercepted him as his activities seemed suspicious.

228.title: US adds 5.28 lakh jobs in July, unemployment rate falls to 3.5%
228.article_body: The US added 5.28 lakh jobs in July with the unemployment rate falling to 3.5%. The report comes days after the US government reported that job vacancies across the country had dropped by 6.05 lakh to 1.07 crore by June-end. The department also revised data for June, showing 3.98 lakh jobs created instead of the previously reported 3.72 lakh.

229.title: Wrestler Sakshi Malik wins her bout within 70 seconds, reaches semi-finals at CWG 2022
229.article_body: Indian wrestler Sakshi Malik won her quarter-final bout in the women's freestyle 62kg event at CWG 2022 within 70 seconds to reach the semi-finals. Sakshi, who had won silver medal at CWG 2014 and bronze medal at CWG 2018, won her bout against Kelsey Barnes by fall. Sakshi will face Cameroon's Berthe Emilienne Etane Ngolle in the semi-final.

230.title: Congress isn't letting the Parliament function: BJP MP Hema Malini
230.article_body: BJP MP Hema Malini refused to comment on the protests staged by the Congress party under their nationwide campaign against rising inflation and unemployment in the country. "I'll not comment on Congress' protests over inflation. Our government, PM Modi and Amit Shah will decide what has to be done," Hema said. "They (Congress) aren't letting the Parliament function," she added.

231.title: Pune bus authority scraps new route diversions following criticism
231.article_body: Pune's public bus service provider scrapped its earlier move to divert long-route buses on Bajirao and Shivaji roads through Deccan and Fergusson College roads. Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) made the decision after commuters said diversions were affecting their schedules. "From August 4, long-distance bus routes will run as per the prior schedules," an official said.

232.title: Rehearsal for Muharram procession with elephant held in Hyderabad
232.article_body: A rehearsal with the elephant for Bibi Ka Alam Muharram procession was held in Hyderabad on Friday by members of the Shia Muslim community. This is considered one of the largest among all religious processions in Hyderabad. "To ensure...the elephant does not panic to loud noise or a sea of the crowd, a rehearsal is done," an organiser said.

233.title: Tulika Maan, who won silver medal, lost 30 kg in a year to take part in CWG 2022
233.article_body: Indian judoka Tulika Maan, who bagged silver at CWG 2022, weighed around 115 kg last year and lost 30 kg in a year to participate at the Games. "When...probables were decided a year ago...she wasn't among the players picked. She brought her weight down to 85 kg...to get into shape. She weighs about 89-90 kg now," coach Jiwan Sharma said.

234.title: India's Manika, Sreeja enter quarters in table tennis event at CWG 2022
234.article_body: India's table tennis players Manika Batra and Sreeja Akula reached the quarter-finals of women's singles at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Friday. Manika defeated Australia's  Minhyung Jee 4-0 in the round of 16, while Sreeja beat Wales' Charlotte Carey 4-3. Meanwhile, Reeth Tennison of India lost to Tianwei Feng of Singapore 1-4.

235.title: 2 men awarded 20-year prison term for gang-rape in Ghaziabad
235.article_body: Two men were awarded 20 years of rigorous imprisonment by a Ghaziabad court on Wednesday after they were found guilty of gang-rape of a 25-year-old healthcare worker on September 22, 2017, near Raj Nagar Extension. The two were also fined ₹50,000 each for the crime. A third suspect was let off as his involvement could not be established, prosecution informed.

236.title: Bumrah, Shami, Bhuvneshwar: Sridhar picks India's pace attack for T20 WC
236.article_body: Speaking about India's possible pace line-up for T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India fielding coach R Sridhar said the top three fast bowlers would be Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammad Shami and Bhuvneshwar Kumar. "Because, if you have this, you have an absolute banker, banker, banker new-ball bowler and death-over bowler in Bhuvi who is in...best shape in terms of his fitness."

237.title: Encounter breaks out in J&K's Kulgam; 1 jawan, 1 civilian injured
237.article_body: An encounter broke out between security forces and terrorists in the Redwani area of J&K's Kulgam district on Friday, police informed. "One Army Jawan and one civilian got injured in the encounter," Kashmir Zone Police tweeted. A cordon and search operation was initially launched after information regarding presence of terrorists in the area was received, an official said.

238.title: Mumbai man cheated out of ₹7.5 lakh in 'sextortion' racket
238.article_body: A 43-year-old man from Mumbai's Chinchpokli has been cheated out of ₹7.5 lakh in an alleged 'sextortion' racket, police said on Friday. The victim recently video chatted with a woman, during which she undressed. Later, a man impersonating a policeman demanded money from the victim, saying the woman had died by suicide after her clip with him was circulated online.

239.title: In a first, Assam awards govt staff for ethics, dedication & punctuality
239.article_body: In a first, Assam government awarded 99 non-gazetted state government employees for their dedication, work ethics and punctuality. The event took place on Friday on the occasion of Lok Kalyan Diwas to mark the death anniversary of Assam's first Chief Minister and Bharat Ratna, Gopinath Bordoloi. The awardees were given a year's extension of service with ₹25,000 and a citation.

240.title: Leopard electrocuted to death at a tiger reserve in MP's Sidhi
240.article_body: A leopard was electrocuted to death in Madhya Pradesh's Sanjay Dubri Tiger Reserve, according to wildlife officials. "The animal had died hours before the carcass was spotted on Friday morning...Locals may have also played a part, we are finding out the details," an official said. In June, two leopards were electrocuted at a wildlife zone in Madhya Pradesh's Satna.

241.title: Crypto exchange WazirX's bank assets worth ₹65 crore frozen by ED
241.article_body: ED has frozen bank assets worth ₹64.67 crore of Indian cryptocurrency exchange WazirX following a search on the premises of its Director Sameer Mhatre. ED said the action is for "assisting accused instant loan app companies in laundering fraud money via purchase and transfer of virtual crypto assets". The government earlier said ED is probing WazirX transactions worth ₹2,790 crore.

242.title: Noida doctor gets warning after a patient she refused to see dies
242.article_body: A female doctor of the District Hospital in Noida Sector 30 has been issued a warning for not seeing a patient on Thursday who later died due to health complications, an official informed. The patient was however attended by other doctors, he added. The deceased's relatives alleged that the doctor refused to see the patient as "he was a male".

243.title: Ambulance driver held for assaulting woman at Hyd's Osmania Hospital
243.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Friday arrested 35-year-old Mohd Arif, an ambulance driver, for allegedly threatening and physically assaulting a woman at Osmania General Hospital. Two days ago, Arif allegedly assaulted 27-year-old Begum after an argument at the hospital premises. "Arif who was seated on a chair stood up and charged towards Begum and repeatedly slapped and pushed her," police said.

244.title: School kids ferried on tractor after cars get stuck due to rain in Bengaluru
244.article_body: A video circulating on social media shows students boarding a tractor to go to their school in Bengaluru. The residents of Rainbow Drive Layout on Sarjapur Road had reportedly hired two tractors after their respective cars, parked in the basement, got stuck due to rainfall-induced waterlogging. The residents alleged that no municipal official had come to clear the flood.

245.title: Ranbir's film with Luv delayed, actor to resume shoot after 'Animal': Reports
245.article_body: Filmmaker Luv Ranjan's upcoming film starring Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor will reportedly be delayed due to the fire incident that took place on the set of the film in Mumbai last week. According to reports, Ranbir will resume shooting for Luv's yet-untitled film after completing Sandeep Reddy Vanga's 'Animal'. Luv's film will also feature Dimple Kapadia.

246.title: Why is Cong scared of investigating agencies: Thakur amid protests
246.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised the Congress for protesting against questioning of the party leaders in the National Herald case and asked why the Congress is scared of investigating agencies. "Putting pressure on these agencies is not fair. They're only doing their work," Anurag Thakur said. "Sonia ji and Rahul ji, please don't play such games," Thakur added.

247.title: 4 NLFT militants surrender along with weapons in Tripura
247.article_body: Four militants of National Liberation Front of Tripura (NLFT) and two of their collaborators surrendered before the police on Friday, an official said. They surrendered one AK-47 rifle with two magazines, two pistols with three magazines and a notebook containing extortion notices, the official added. The militants led by Umesh Koloi reportedly entered Tripura from Bangladesh on July 21.

248.title: 40-year-old Sharath Kamal defeats 23 years younger opponent, reaches pre-quarterfinals
248.article_body: India's 40-year-old table tennis player Sharath Kamal, who had bagged men's singles gold at CWG 2006, defeated 17-year-old Finn Luu of Australia to reach the pre-quarterfinals at CWG 2022. Sharath Kamal won the match with a scoreline of 12-10, 11-8, 11-7, 11-6. Earlier at the ongoing Games, Sharath Kamal bagged the men's team gold medal.

249.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
249.article_body: Isolated very heavy rainfall is likely over Karnataka on August 5 and 6, Tamil Nadu and Kerala on August 5, Telangana during August 5-9 and Andhra Pradesh on August 8 and 9. Rainfall is also likely over Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat, Maharashtra and Goa. Odisha and Rajasthan are also likely to experience very heavy rainfall between August 7-9.

250.title: 5 poachers arrested from wildlife sanctuary in Odisha's Bargarh
250.article_body: Five suspected poachers were arrested from Debrigarh Wildlife Sanctuary in Odisha's Bargarh on Friday, a forest official said. The poachers entered the wildlife sanctuary to hunt sambar deer and bison for their horns and skin, the official added. Acting on a tip-off, an 18-member patrol team apprehended the suspects and seized a sambar horn, an axe, wire traps and motorcycles.

251.title: Congratulations on your gold medal: Anurag Thakur to para powerlifter Sudhir
251.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur took to Twitter following Indian para powerlifter Sudhir's gold medal in men's heavyweight category at CWG 2022 and wrote, "Congratulations on your gold medal at your first CWG." He added, "With the display of skill and spirit on...mat today you showed the world what champions are made of." Notably, the 27-year-old set a CWG record.

252.title: Video shows Priyanka being dragged into police van amid protest in Delhi
252.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra was detained by Delhi Police as she and other party members protested against unemployment and inflation outside Congress headquarters on Friday. A video showed five to six female constables dragging Priyanka and lifting her into a police vehicle. Earlier, she was seen jumping over a police barricade to participate in the protest.

253.title: Man carrying ₹112 cr heroin on Delhi-bound train arrested in B'luru
253.article_body: A man carrying 16 kg of heroin worth ₹112 crore was arrested in a train that was bound to leave for Delhi from Bengaluru railway station. Officers of the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence found the drugs concealed in a false cavity inside his trolley bag. The 35-year-old man, believed to be from Tamil Nadu, had arrived in Bengaluru from Ethiopia.

254.title: Germany's Health Minister tests positive for coronavirus
254.article_body: German Health Minister Karl Lauterbach has tested positive for coronavirus, the German Health Ministry announced on Friday. "The minister is fine, he has only mild symptoms. He is temporarily conducting his official duties from home isolation," it said. Lauterbach is an epidemiologist by training who has led Germany's fight against COVID-19 since December.

255.title: Ex-Mumbai Police Commissioner denied bail in NSE phone tapping case
255.article_body: Former Commissioner of Mumbai Police Sanjay Pandey's bail application in a money laundering case has been denied by a special court in Delhi. Judge Sunena Sharma said prima facie evidence showed Pandey was involved in snooping on employees of the National Stock Exchange (NSE). The Enforcement Directorate arrested Pandey on July 19 and he is currently in judicial custody.

256.title: Police probe severe thrashing of 2 dogs in Pune last month
256.article_body: Pune City Police has launched an investigation into the severe beating of two dogs in the city's Wagholi area last month. According to the FIR filed by an animal activist, an unidentified man thrashed the dogs near Panchshil Towers Society on July 22. Sections under the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, 1960, have been invoked in the case.

257.title: No trees cut for metro shed in Aarey, only branches trimmed: MMRCL
257.article_body: Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation Limited (MMRCL) told Supreme Court that no trees have been cut for the construction of a metro car shed in Mumbai's Aarey Forest area since 2019. MMRCL also assured that no trees in the area would be cut until the next hearing, dated August 10. Only some bushes and branches have been trimmed, MMRCL added.

258.title: War in Ukraine can't be ended by ignoring Russia: Turkey
258.article_body: The international community cannot end the war in Ukraine by ignoring Russia, a top aide to Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said. "The truth is that some of our friends don't want the war to end. They're shedding crocodile tears," Fahrettin Altun added. Turkey has been mediating between Moscow and Kyiv since the beginning of the ongoing war.

259.title: Rupee closes higher by 17 paise at 79.23 against US dollar
259.article_body: The rupee rose by 17 paise to close at 79.23 (provisional) against the US dollar on Friday from its previous close of 79.40 after the Reserve Bank of India increased the repo rate by 50 basis points to 5.40%. The rupee was boosted by foreign fund inflows into capital markets and softening crude oil prices, forex traders said.

260.title: India's para TT players Alagar, Sonalben to fight for bronze at CWG on Saturday
260.article_body: Indian para table tennis players Raj Aravindan Alagar and Sonalben Manubhai Patel lost in their respective semi-finals at CWG 2022 on Friday. Alagar lost to Nigeria's Nasiru Sule 1-3 in men's singles classes 3-5, while Sonalben lost to Nigeria's Ifechukwude Christiana Ikpeoyi 1-3 in women's singles classes 3-5. Both Alagar and Sonalben will play for the bronze medal on Saturday.

261.title: Pune man involved in father-son duo's murder arrested from Beed
261.article_body: Police have arrested a man identified as Ketan Kolte (28) from Beed for his alleged involvement in the murder of a father-son duo that took place in Pune seven months back. Police have also arrested eight others in the case. The accused reportedly attacked the victims while they were travelling in a car following a fallout from a previous dispute.

262.title: Not putting Batgirl out unless we believe in it: Warner Bros Discovery CEO
262.article_body: After the movie 'Batgirl' got cancelled, Warner Bros Discovery CEO, David Zaslav, said that the broadcasting company is going to focus on quality. "We're not going to launch a movie until it's ready, we're not going to go to movie to make a quarter, and we're not going to put the movie out unless we believe in it," he added.

263.title: Was bullied online for gaining weight, it was so surprising: Harnaaz Sandhu
263.article_body: Miss Universe Harnaaz Sandhu revealed that she has "kind of grown physically and got more pounds" since being crowned in December, adding that she's "totally comfortable" with it. However, the 22-year-old added that she was bullied online for gaining weight. "It was kind of uncomfortable and really surprising...to see how people started having...opinions, which shouldn't really matter," she said.

264.title: Assam delegation to visit Mizoram to discuss border dispute
264.article_body: A five-member delegation headed by Assam Border Protection and Development Minister Atul Bora will be on a two-day visit to Mizoram from August 9 to discuss the border dispute with the neighbouring state. Meanwhile, Mizoram Home Minister Lalchamliana will lead his side of the team. Many conflicts have taken place between both the states in the last few years.

265.title: BSF arrests Pakistani fisherman off Gujarat coast, seizes 5 boats
265.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) on Friday arrested one Pakistani fisherman and seized five boats from Harami Nala creek area in Gujarat's Kutch district. During patrolling, the BSF troops observed movement of some fishing boats near the India-Pakistan border early today. While other fishermen escaped successfully, the BSF managed to arrest one Pakistani national, a release by the BSF said.

266.title: Titan's Q1 profit surges 1,200% to ₹793 crore, revenue up by 176%
266.article_body: Titan Company on Friday reported a 1,200% year-on-year growth in its standalone profit after tax at ₹793 crore in the quarter ended June as against ₹61 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Its standalone revenue rose by 176% to ₹8,961 crore as compared to ₹3,249 crore year-on-year. Titan's shares were trading at ₹2,445.2 on the NSE on Friday.

267.title: Wrestling venue at CWG 2022 emptied due to security alert
267.article_body: The venue for wrestling events at CWG 2022 has been emptied in Birmingham due to security alert. "We're taking a short pause for a safety check and will resume action once we receive the go-ahead," United World Wrestling tweeted. As many as nine matches had already been completed before the events were paused.

268.title: Richa Chadha, Ali Fazal to tie the knot in September: Reports
268.article_body: Actors Ali Fazal and Richa Chadha are all set to tie the knot in September this year. "It's happening, the couple will make an announcement soon," The Indian Express quoted sources as saying. Richa and Ali will reportedly have two ceremonies, one in Mumbai and the other in Delhi. The actors first met on the sets of 'Fukrey' in 2012.

269.title: India have had 7 captains in the past year, it's quite inappropriate: Latif
269.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said India have had around seven captains in the past year, which is "quite inappropriate". "Pakistan's strategy looks much better...There's no doubt that India have the best players, but they can't make their best-16," added Latif. "Pakistan won because of India's mistakes last year and...this time, Pakistan will benefit from India's mistakes again," he stated.

270.title: People used to ask why I work on 4 films a year, told me to slow down: Akshay
270.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said that people used to ask him why he works on four films in a year. "People have always asked me to slow down and ease out on the number of films I act in or produce...I take the maximum number of holidays...I never work on Sundays. I always work half a day on Saturday," he added.

271.title: Ready to discuss prisoner swap with US: Russia after Griner's conviction
271.article_body: Russia's Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said Russia is ready to discuss a prisoner swap with US through a diplomatic channel agreed upon by both Presidents. "If...Americans decide to...again resort to public diplomacy...it's their problem," he added. This comes a day after US basketball player Brittney Griner was convicted of drug smuggling and sentenced to nine years in a Russian prison.

272.title: Deepak Punia enters men's 86-kg quarterfinals in wrestling at CWG 2022
272.article_body: Indian wrestler Deepak Punia defeated New Zealand's Matthew Oxenham 10-0 by technical superiority to enter the men's 86-kg quarterfinals at the CWG 2022. Fellow wrestler Bajrang Punia has entered the men's 65-kg quarterfinals after beating Nauru's Lowe Bingham in one minute and 47 seconds. India have won 20 medals so far, including six gold, seven silver and seven bronze medals.

273.title: Armed men rob ₹44 lakh from bank in Gujarat's Bharuch; 4 arrested
273.article_body: Four men were arrested for allegedly robbing ₹44 lakh from a bank after holding its staff hostage at gunpoint in Gujarat's Bharuch district. The incident took place at a branch of Union Bank of India on Thursday afternoon, police said. While one of them was captured following shootout by police on Thursday, three others were arrested later, police added.

274.title: UP Police share video of bike ramming into car, urge people to drive safely
274.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Police took to Twitter to share a video of a bike-borne man ramming his two-wheeler into a car. While urging people to drive safely, the Uttar Pradesh Police wrote, "'Either up, or ahead'...There's only one direction you can go at once! Being 'foolhardy' on the roads can be the end of your 'journey'."

275.title: Pentagon names Air Force General as new Press Secretary
275.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said Air Force Brigadier General Patrick Ryder will be the next Pentagon Press Secretary, the first uniformed officer to fill the position since 2015. Ryder will replace John Kirby, who earlier this summer became White House's National Security Council Coordinator for Strategic Communications. Ryder currently serves as the Air Force's Director of Public Affairs.

276.title: MPs can't avoid summons when House is in session: RS Chairman Naidu
276.article_body: Vice President and Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu said Members of Parliament (MPs) can't avoid summons by law enforcement agencies in criminal cases "when the session is on or otherwise". "As law-abiding citizens...it's our duty to respect the law and legal procedure," Naidu said. This comes a day after ED summoned Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge during Rajya Sabha session.

277.title: Mahindra & Mahindra Q1 net profit jumps 67% to ₹1,430 crore
277.article_body: Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) on Friday reported a 67% surge in net profit to ₹1,430.2 crore for the quarter ended June as against ₹857 crore in the year-ago period. Its revenue from operations rose to ₹19,612.6 crore compared to ₹11,764.82 crore in the same quarter last fiscal. The shares of M&M ended 2% lower at ₹1,236.2 at the BSE.

278.title: Fortunate to have backing but it's survival of fittest: Naga on nepotism
278.article_body: While talking about nepotism, actor Naga Chaitanya said he is fortunate to have backing but it is survival of fittest. "If my film releases and parallelly Mr. X or Y's film releases...and they are not from film family...and his or her film collects 100 crore...and mine collects 10...first phone call of producers and directors [will] go to them," he added.

279.title: Dividing cinema into regions not fair, it belongs to everyone: Manoj
279.article_body: Speaking about the north-south cinema debate, actor Manoj Bajpayee stated that dividing cinema into regions is not fair, adding that cinema belongs to everyone. The actor further said, "For me, India is from Kashmir to Kanyakumari and not from Kashmir to Delhi...If Telugu films do well, I will be just as proud as when a Hindi film does well."

280.title: I get gaalis in DMs and comments for playing a vamp: Riya Bhattacharje
280.article_body: Actress Riya Bhattacharje, who portrays Akriti Saxena on television show 'Kabhi Kabhie Ittefaq Sey', has revealed that she received hate comments and DMs for portraying a negative role. "I get gaalis...There are comments like, 'Tu marr kyun nahi jaati (Why don't you die)?" the actress added. Riya said that it bothered her initially but now she just blocks the trolls.

281.title: MP govt orders probe into land allotted to National Herald in Bhopal
281.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government has ordered a probe into the land allotted to the National Herald newspaper in Bhopal. "I have issued an order to form an inquiry committee to probe...in Press Complex...where commercial buildings have come up by violating the rules," State Minister Bhupendra Singh said. "If any irregularities are found, we will...seal it off," Singh added.

282.title: 28-yr-old man arrested for molesting woman at Thane railway station
282.article_body: A 28-year-old man, Prateek Prakash Gurav, was arrested for allegedly molesting a 34-year-old woman commuter at Thane railway station, an official said on Thursday. "He was pinned down by others on the platform after the woman raised an alarm," Thane railway police official said. Gurav has been charged under IPC section 354 (assaults or uses criminal force to any woman).

283.title: Balenciaga sells pouch 'inspired by garbage bag' for ₹1.4 lakh, Twitter users react
283.article_body: Luxury fashion brand Balenciaga has unveiled its 'Trash Pouch', a $1,790 (around ₹1.4 lakh) bag "inspired by a garbage bag". Pictures of the bag made from calfskin leather have gone viral. "Thank you Balenciaga for making rich people carry out their trash bags," said a Twitter user. "It's the end of the world as we know it," said another.

284.title: It's an honour: Ranveer Singh on hosting 2022 Filmfare Awards
284.article_body: Speaking about hosting the 2022 Filmfare Awards, actor Ranveer Singh said it's an honour to be a part of "the celebration of excellence in Hindi cinema in this grand manner". He added that he used to read Filmfare magazine from cover to cover during his childhood. "I used to also take cut-outs from the magazines and save them," Ranveer said.

285.title: BJP will change the Tiranga, bring in saffron flag: Mehbooba Mufti
285.article_body: PDP chief and former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti on Friday criticised the BJP and and said the party will change the tricolour to a saffron flag. "In time to come, BJP will finish off even the Constitution and the foundations of secularism on which this country stands," Mufti said. "They'll make this a religious country," she added.

286.title: Man slips on rock, falls into waterfall while posing for pics in TN
286.article_body: A man in his 20s slipped on a rock and fell into a waterfall while posing for pictures in Pullaveli in Tamil Nadu's Kodaikanal. A video of the incident, which was captured by the man's friend who was reportedly taking the pictures, has surfaced online. The police and fire department have launched a search for the man following the incident.

287.title: Bribery has become routine in K'taka: HC while rejecting IAS officer's bail
287.article_body: Karnataka High Court, while rejecting IAS officer J Manjunath's bail application, said that bribery has become routine in government offices in the state. Manjunath was arrested on July 4 in a case involving a ₹5-lakh bribe by the Anti-Corruption Bureau. "Without bribes, no files will move in the usual course. Getting bribes has become a rule...it's like cancer," HC stated.

288.title: China ending cooperation with US on multiple issues after Pelosi's Taiwan visit
288.article_body: China has said it is ending cooperation with US on multiple issues after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan. It has halted dialogue with US on climate change, military issues and anti-drug work in retaliation to the visit. China has also sanctioned Pelosi and her immediate family members over the Taiwan visit.

289.title: Lady Gaga confirms she will star in Joaquin Phoenix's Joker 2
289.article_body: Actress-singer Lady Gaga has confirmed that she will be featuring alongside actor Joaquin Phoenix in 'Joker: Folie a Deux'. The film will be a sequel to the 2019 film 'Joker' which won Joaquin an Oscar for Best Actor. Details about Gaga's role have not been announced yet but as per reports, she will portray Harley Quinn in the upcoming film.

290.title: Some Japanese offices temporarily shut as COVID-19 cases surge
290.article_body: As COVID-19 cases surge in Japan, some companies such as Toyota Motor and Daihatsu Motor have halted production line shifts. Others, such as KFC Holdings Japan, have shut some restaurants, while Japan Post Holdings has shut more than 200 mailing centres temporarily. Japan reported over 1.4 million new COVID-19 cases over the past week, the WHO data showed.

291.title: Body of 20-yr-old man, who was murdered, found floating in Thane lake
291.article_body: The body of a 20-year-old man, who was allegedly murdered, was found floating in a lake in Ambernath town of Thane, police said on Friday. The deceased has been identified as Vishal Sarvajit Rajbhar. His body was stuffed in a gunny sack with stone-filled bags tied to his legs and neck, police added. A case of murder has been registered.

292.title: Plan travel on I-day weekend with time: B'luru Airport on passenger surge
292.article_body: The Bengaluru Airport authorities took to Twitter to say that passengers travelling to the city should plan their travel with sufficient time as a surge in passenger volumes is expected on the Independence Day long weekend. A link to monitor queue wait times was also shared by the authorities on Twitter.

293.title: SC to hear plea to declare 'Ram Setu' a national heritage monument
293.article_body: The Supreme Court has decided to hear BJP leader Subramanian Swamy's petition to get the 'Ram Setu' designated as a national heritage monument. A three-judge bench was to hear the matter on July 26, however, it could not do so as one of the judges had some health issues. Swamy had mentioned the case for urgent listing on July 13.

294.title: China's military drills around Taiwan are significant escalation: US
294.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Friday said that China's military exercises around Taiwan, including missiles fired into Japan's exclusive economic zone, represent a "significant escalation". China launched the military drills following a visit by US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to Taiwan. Pelosi's visit was peaceful and did not represent a change in US policy toward Taiwan, Blinken added.

295.title: Sensex jumps 89 points, Nifty settles near 17,400 after repo rate hiked by 50 bps
295.article_body: The benchmark indices ended on a higher note on Friday after the RBI raised the repo rate by 50 bps to 5.40%, the highest since 2019. While BSE Sensex gained 89 points to settle at 58,387.93, Nifty ended near 17,400. Among the losers, shares of Mahindra & Mahindra were down by 2%, followed by Reliance Industries and Maruti Suzuki India.

296.title: African national arrested, cocaine worth ₹24 lakh seized in Thane
296.article_body: The Thane Crime Branch on Wednesday arrested an African national from Thane's Wagle Estate area for allegedly carrying cocaine worth ₹24 lakh. The operation was carried out by Unit-V Senior Inspector Vikas Ghodke and his team. "We found 60 grams of cocaine...We've registered a case under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act," Vikas Ghodke said.

297.title: China summons Japanese, EU diplomats over statements on Taiwan
297.article_body: China said it has summoned the Japanese ambassador and European diplomats in the country to protest statements issued by the Group of Seven (G7) nations and the European Union criticising Chinese military exercises around Taiwan. Vice Foreign Minister Deng Li called the statements "erroneous" and objected to "wanton interference in China's internal affairs", the Chinese Foreign Ministry said.

298.title: All fever patients have recovered since COVID outbreak, says N Korea
298.article_body: North Korea on Friday said that all of its fever patients have recovered, marking the end of its first outbreak of coronavirus. The "anti-epidemic situation...has entered a definite phase of stability", state media said. North Korea would "redouble efforts to maintain perfection in the execution of state anti-epidemic policies", it added.

299.title: ED names Avinash Bhosale's son in Pune land grab case charge-sheet
299.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) filed a charge-sheet against Pune builder Avinash Bhosale's son, Amit Bhosale, in connection with a land grab case. ARA Properties and two others were also named in the charge-sheet. It was alleged that the land was transferred to ARA Properties, violating allotment rules. Bhosale and his son were accused of developing a commercial building on the land.

300.title: Man aiming at lizard mistakenly shoots 8-yr-old boy with air gun in Hyd
300.article_body: A 32-year-old man named Abdul Afsar has been booked for allegedly shooting an eight-year-old boy in Moghalpura, Hyderabad. Police said Afsar was shooting pellets at a dog when the victim, Azaan, asked him to aim at a lizard. Afsar tried shooting the lizard but the pellet hit the wall and got redirected towards Azaan and hit him, police added.

301.title: Car dangles from 25-foot-high wall after crash in Hyd, video emerges
301.article_body: A car was seen dangling from a 25 feet high wall at Raj Bhavan Road in Hyderabad on Wednesday evening. As per reports, the car crashed into the railing wall of a building after the brakes failed. Locals reportedly helped the driver get out of the car following the crash. The vehicle was lifted to safety using a crane.

302.title: Canadian hockey player Balraj grabs neck of opponent during CWG match, video goes viral
302.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Canadian hockey player Balraj Panesar grabbing the neck of English player Chris Griffiths during their CWG 2022 match. The fight erupted after Griffiths pulled on Panesar's stick after which Panesar grabbed his neck and tried to push him to the ground. Panesar was shown a red card.

303.title: CCTV clip shows woman throwing 4-yr-old daughter from 4th floor in B'luru, girl dies
303.article_body: A CCTV video has shown a woman throwing her four-year-old daughter from the fourth floor of a building in Bengaluru, killing the child. The video shows the accused woman climbing the railings after throwing her daughter but her family pulled her back. Police said the woman, who's a dentist, was depressed as her daughter was unable to hear or talk.

304.title: Dhamki-jeevi has intensified toxic politics of vendetta: Jairam
304.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh has criticised the BJP government for allegedly doing "vendetta" politics. "Ever since Congress President (Sonia Gandhi) announced Kanyakumari to Kashmir Bharat Jodo Yatra almost 3 months back, Dhamki-jeevi has intensified his toxic politics of vendetta," Jairam tweeted. The ED had recently questioned Congress leaders, Sonia and Rahul Gandhi over the National Herald case.

305.title: Do you have democracy in Congress: Ravi Shankar to Rahul Gandhi
305.article_body: Replying to Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's "death of democracy" comment, BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad said that Rahul Gandhi should not preach on democracy. "Do you have democracy in your party? If the country has seen dictatorship, then it has seen in the rule of Congress," said Prasad. He further added that Rahul is not serious about politics.

306.title: Drake launches T-shirt in honour of Sidhu Moose Wala
306.article_body: Rapper Drake has launched a T-shirt in honour of Sidhu Moose Wala. "We celebrate your life and influence in India, Canada, everywhere. Rest in peace to our friend and legend...We are working with Sidhu's family to dedicate proceeds from this drop in his honour," the rapper wrote in an Instagram post.

307.title: I'm bored of it, still attached to it: Naga Chaitanya on his divorce news
307.article_body: While talking about media reports after his divorce with actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu, actor Naga Chaitanya said, "It's just people trying to fill up columns and there's nothing else. I mean I'm bored of it. I have been through three releases and I'm still attached to it." "We both have immense respect for each other," he added.

308.title: His silver medal at CWG is a special one: PM Modi on long jumper Sreeshankar
308.article_body: Congratulating Murali Sreeshankar following his silver medal in men's long jump final at Commonwealth Games 2022, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Sreeshankar's silver medal at the CWG is a special one...his performance augurs well for the future of Indian athletics." President Droupadi Murmu said, "Your long leap has brought India's first ever medal for this event in the Commonwealth Games."

309.title: 42 migrant workers died in Gurugram this year: Police
309.article_body: At least 42 migrant workers died in Gurugram until July 30 this year, out of these, 20 workers were killed in accidents at construction sites, police said. These accidents included caving in of soil while digging basements, falling from multi-storey buildings, electrocution etc. The remaining 22 deaths were reported from offices, workshops, factories and other workplaces, police added.

310.title: Bezos' $500 mn yacht towed from Dutch shipyard as dismantling of bridge cancelled
310.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' $500 million megayacht was towed away from a Dutch shipyard weeks after its manufacturer withdrew request to dismantle a bridge built in 1927 to allow passage for the vessel. The 417-foot-long yacht was relocated early Tuesday morning to the Greenport yard in Rotterdam. Earlier, local residents threatened to egg the yacht if the bridge was dismantled.

311.title: A lot of question marks now present themselves: Styris on KL Rahul
311.article_body: Ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris said there are a "lot of question marks" over opportunities for KL Rahul in Team India's lineup, having not played any competitive cricket since IPL 2022. "Other players are...scoring runs and...posing the selectors some questions saying, 'Do we actually need Rahul?'" added Styris. "[Will] Rahul...be in good form when he comes back?" stated Styris.

312.title: Bajrang begins India's wrestling campaign at CWG 2022 with a win, reaches quarter-finals
312.article_body: Olympic bronze medal-winning wrestler Bajrang Punia began India's wrestling campaign at CWG 2022 with a victory against Lowe Bingham of Nauru in the men's freestyle 65 kg category. With the victory, Bajrang advanced to the quarter-finals. Bajrang had bagged gold medal at CWG 2018 and a silver medal at CWG 2014.

313.title: World's smallest singer Abdu Rozik to play gangster in Salman's 'Bhaijaan'
313.article_body: Tajikistan-born Abdu Rozik, the world's smallest singer, will make his Bollywood debut with Salman Khan's upcoming movie 'Bhaijaan'. Talking to The Indian Express, the 18-year-old singer said, "I'm playing a gangster in the movie, small bhaijaan to the big bhaijaan." Abdu, who met Salman at IIFA 2022, added that he is a great human being who has a good heart.

314.title: TRS to support Opposition candidate in Vice-Presidential poll
314.article_body: TRS is set to support Opposition's candidate Margaret Alva for the Vice-Presidential election, slated to be held on August 6. Alva filed her nomination for the polls on July 19. On the other hand, NDA has fielded West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar as its candidate. Tenure of incumbent Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu will end on August 10.

315.title: Gold worth over ₹69 lakh seized at Bengaluru Airport; 2 arrested
315.article_body: Bengaluru Customs officials on Wednesday arrested two people for trying to smuggle over 1 kg gold worth ₹69.74 lakh. Based on specific intelligence, officials intercepted two passengers who had arrived from Sri Lanka and recovered gold that was concealed inside their rectum, Bengaluru Customs tweeted. Last month, over 500 grams of gold was recovered from one passenger at Bengaluru Airport.

316.title: 106-year-old college astronomy lab in Bihar added to UNESCO heritage list
316.article_body: A 106-year-old astronomical observatory in Bihar has been added to UNESCO's list of important endangered heritage observatories. The observatory, established in Langat Singh College in Muzaffarpur in 1916, is reportedly the first of its kind in eastern India. The college authorities said they're hopeful the state government will take steps for conserving it after its inclusion in UNESCO's list.

317.title: Disney scrapped our holiday special, RIP Shang Chi: Simu Liu
317.article_body: Actor Simu Liu announced on Twitter that Disney has scrapped the upcoming Shang-Chi Holiday Special over "quality control concerns". The actor wrote, "I had already filmed the entire thing. I even designed an all-gingerbread Ta Lo. RIP Shang Chi and the Legend of the TEEEN GOLDEN RIIIIINGS." Disney or Marvel have not yet released a statement over the matter.

318.title: My parents never bothered me over relationship with Mathias Boe: Taapsee
318.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu has stated that her parents have never bothered her with questions about what she does in her personal or professional life. She is dating badminton player-turned-coach Mathias Boe. "They are happy with the way I have dealt with both aspects of my life and ensured I don't ignore one for the other," the actress added.

319.title: TN CM Stalin changes profile pic to Karunanidhi with national flag
319.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Thursday changed the profile picture on his social media handles to a photo of late DMK head and former state CM M Karunanidhi with the national flag in the background. Stalin, who is Karunanidhi's son, also stated that his father ensured state CMs' right to hoist the national flag on August 15 in 1974.

320.title: 2 arrested for stabbing cab driver to death in Delhi
320.article_body: Two men were arrested from Palam Vihar on Tuesday for allegedly stabbing a cab driver to death on July 15. According to police, the accused, who had booked the cab online, poured chilli powder into the driver's eyes to force him to share his UPI code for transferring money from his bank account. The incident took place in Faridabad's Pali.

321.title: Para table tennis player Bhavina reaches final, assures India of another medal at CWG
321.article_body: Para table tennis player Bhavina Patel assured India of another medal at CWG 2022 by reaching the final of the women's singles classes 3-5 event. The 35-year-old defeated England's Sue Bailey in the semi-final. Notably, Bhavina had bagged a silver medal at the Tokyo Paralympics last year, which was India's first-ever medal in para table tennis in Paralympic history.

322.title: 32-yr-old FTII student found dead in hostel room, police say 'likely suicide'
322.article_body: A 32-year-old final year student was found dead inside the hostel room of Film and Television Institute of India. Police were called after the student did not open door after repeated requests. "Upon opening door, it was ascertained that the death may have occurred a few days ago," police said, describing it as "likely suicide".

323.title: PMC initiates process for third-party quality audit of 640 roads
323.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has initiated the process for a third-party audit of construction quality of 640 roads in the city amid complaints about the state of roads. The roads were identified under Defect Liability Period, which is a clause in the contract wherein the contractor can be held liable for deterioration of a road's quality within a specific period.

324.title: Cyclone Tauktae uprooted 3.5 mn+ trees in Gir National Park: Guj Forest Dept
324.article_body: Cyclone Tauktae uprooted over 3.5 million trees in Gujarat's Gir National Park in May 2021, the state Forest Department has said after multiple surveys. Reports said the state Forest Department has submitted its final report on fallen trees over a year after Cyclone Tauktae. The department has estimated 30% of the trees in Gir were uprooted based on satellite data.

325.title: Twitter didn't disclose its risky litigation against Indian govt amid merger: Musk
325.article_body: In its countersuit against Twitter, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said the company did not disclose that it had filed for "risky" litigation against the Indian government amid their deal, thereby "placing its third-largest market at risk". Musk added that Twitter must follow the laws in India. Meanwhile, Twitter replied that it has challenged certain blocking orders by the Indian government.

326.title: 'You've never seen Earth like this,' says ESA on pics depicting ground motion
326.article_body: European Space Agency (ESA) shared pictures depicting ground motion around Mount Etna and Bologna in Italy, as well as an area around Larissa in Greece. "You've never seen Earth like this," ESA captioned the post. "Any movement beneath our feet...spells big trouble. Even relatively modest subsidence can weaken buildings and infrastructure and lead to issues such as flooding," it said.

327.title: Canada requests extradition of French priest accused of child abuse
327.article_body: Canadian Justice Minister David Lametti on Thursday confirmed that Canada has requested the extradition of a French priest accused of sexually abusing indigenous children over 30 years ago. The accused priest left Canada in 1993. Last month, Pope Francis visited Canada and apologised for the role of the Catholic Church in carrying out abuse of indigenous children at residential schools.

328.title: Take family's consent, I'd rather stay in India: Anil on refusing H'wood shows
328.article_body: While talking about turning down Hollywood shows, actor Anil Kapoor said that he would rather stay in India and do what he can here. "I take my family's consent. If they say yes, I do it. I didn't ask earlier, but now I have to ask them if I can stay away from them for so many months," he added.

329.title: Reconsider spending on ads under 'Beti Bachao' scheme: Parl panel to govt
329.article_body: The parliamentary standing committee has urged the Centre to reconsider spending on advertisements under the 'Beti Bachao Beti Padhao' (BBBP) scheme. The panel said that more than 78% of ₹446.72 crore released during 2016-2019 for the scheme was spent only on media advocacy. It added that the government should instead focus on planned expenditure allocation in education and health.

330.title: China sanctions Nancy Pelosi and her family over Taiwan visit
330.article_body: China on Friday announced sanctions on US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and her immediate family members over her trip to Taiwan. The development comes days after Pelosi landed in Taipei despite several warnings from China, becoming the highest ranking US politician to visit Taiwan in 25 years. Earlier today, Pelosi said the US will "not allow China to isolate Taiwan".

331.title: The only thing I liked about K3G was Kareena Kapoor: Aamir Khan
331.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has revealed that the only thing that he liked about filmmaker Karan Johar's 2001 film 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' was actress Kareena Kapoor. Kareena portrayed the character of Poo in the film which features Shah Rukh Khan, Kajol and Hrithik Roshan. Aamir added that he also liked Karan's directorial debut 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai'.

332.title: Rahul is 'fake' Gandhi with 'fake' ideology: Pralhad Joshi
332.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Friday called Congress leader Rahul Gandhi a "fake" Gandhi whose ideology was "fake" as well. "He (Rahul Gandhi) is not a descendant of Mahatma Gandhi," Joshi added. His remarks came after Rahul said Congress was fighting for an ideology for years and the Gandhi family wasn't just one family, but an ideology as a whole.

333.title: HDFC raises ₹8,700 crore 'social loan' for affordable housing segment
333.article_body: HDFC Limited has raised $1.1 billion (around ₹8,700 crore) under the 'Syndicated Social Loan Facility' by way of external commercial borrowings (ECBs) to cater to the affordable housing segment, the company said on Friday. This is the first social ECB loan out of India and the largest ECB loan deal from a housing finance company/private NBFC in India, it added.

334.title: Road to salvation lies through incessant toil: RBI Guv quotes Gandhi after repo rate hike
334.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Friday ended his speech at the Monetary Policy Committee with a quote by Mahatma Gandhi. Das quoted, "For me, the road to salvation lies through incessant toil in the service of my country and there through of humanity." RBI on Friday increased the repo rate by 50 bps to 5.40%, the highest since 2019.

335.title: Air hostess died at Gurugram hospital after being treated by dentist for vaginal bleeding: CBI
335.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation said in its FIR that Rosy Sangma, an air hostess from Nagaland, died due to negligence by a Gurugram private hospital in June last year. The FIR stated that the "critical patient of vaginal bleeding was treated by a dentist who was not at all qualified for the same".

336.title: No details on if Hyderabad was ever named Bhagyanagar: ASI
336.article_body: In a response to an RTI inquiry on if Hyderabad was ever named Bhagnagar or Bhagyanagar, the city's Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) said, "No such details are available with this office." This comes after former Jharkhand CM and BJP leader Raghubar Das said that Hyderabad's name will be changed to Bhagyanagar if BJP comes to power in Telangana.

337.title: Walmart cuts 200 corporate jobs in restructuring effort
337.article_body: Walmart Inc is firing nearly 200 corporate employees in a restructuring effort and workers at its Bentonville, Arkansas headquarters and other corporate offices have been notified. Walmart called the move a way to "better position the company for a strong future". This comes after the company cut its quarterly and full-year profit guidance last month.

338.title: No GST on 'Sarais' run by religious, charitable trusts: Govt
338.article_body: Refuting certain media and social media reports claiming that GST has been imposed on 'Sarais' run by religious/charitable trusts, the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) said, "This is not true." It further said that GST exemption on hotel rooms with room rent up to ₹1,000 per day has been withdrawn and they are now taxed at 12%.

339.title: Hong Kong firm's stock rallies 32,000% in 3 weeks to surpass Goldman Sachs in value
339.article_body: Hong Kong-based financial company AMTD Digital's shares surged 32,000% in less than three weeks after listing in New York. Even though the shares have now lost more than half of their value, the company is still worth more than Goldman Sachs in terms of market capitalisation. Notably, AMTD reported just $25 million in revenue for the year ended April 2021.

340.title: Rajamouli narrated the plot in less than 10 seconds: Sudeepa on 'Makkhi'
340.article_body: Actor Kichcha Sudeepa, who worked with 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli in 'Makkhi' said Rajamouli narrated the film's plot in less than 10 seconds. "I just accepted it," added Sudeepa. Sudeepa was also part of Rajamouli's film 'Baahubali: The Beginning' but wasn't "called" to play the role in the sequel. "I didn't miss being in the second part," he had stated.

341.title: Man axes wife to death; later rushes to Udaipur forest, kills himself
341.article_body: A 44-year-old man, Fata Meena, allegedly killed his wife, Chanda Devi, by hitting her with an axe in Udaipur. Police said that the accused later locked the house and rushed to a forest, where he also died by suicide. Police also said that the couple used to pick fights often. Their bodies were handed over to the family after post-mortem.

342.title: Man who threatened to kill top US health expert Fauci jailed
342.article_body: A 56-year-old US man was sentenced on Thursday to three years in prison for sending threatening emails to top US health expert Anthony Fauci and other health officials. In one of the emails, Thomas Connally Jr threatened that Fauci and his family would be "dragged into the street, beaten to death, and set on fire", the US Justice Department said.

343.title: China has the sovereign right to hold military drills around Taiwan: Russia
343.article_body: Russia said China has the "sovereign right" to hold major military drills around Taiwan. "The tension in the region and around Taiwan was provoked...by the visit of [US House Speaker] Nancy Pelosi," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. "It was an absolutely unnecessary visit and an unnecessary provocation," Peskov added. China began its largest-ever military drills around Taiwan on Thursday.

344.title: Fake news: Carl Pei on report of Nothing Phone (1) Lite launch in India
344.article_body: Nothing CEO and Co-founder Carl Pei dismissed a report that claimed that the company was working to launch a Nothing Phone (1) Lite version. Pei remarked, "Fake news" in response to a report that stated that the Nothing Phone (1) Lite will be an affordable version of the Nothing Phone (1) and may launch in India soon, likely before Diwali.

345.title: UK may enter its longest recession since 2008 this year, warns Bank of England
345.article_body: The UK is projected to enter recession from fourth quarter of this year, the Bank of England has warned. It's expected to last for five quarters in what would be the UK's longest recession since the 2008 global financial crisis. "Inflation hits the least well-off hardest, but if we don't act...the consequences later will be worse," Governor Andrew Bailey said.

346.title: South filmmakers, actors getting their national dues: Dulquer Salmaan
346.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan has stated that South filmmakers and actors are getting their national dues now, adding that it is a big compliment. He further said that any industry going through a rough patch is just a phase. "It's an interesting phase for...industries across [the world]. Not just in India, every film industry is facing the same," the actor added.

347.title: If I spoke perfect Punjabi, people might not understand: Aamir on 'Laal...'
347.article_body: Reacting to criticism over his Punjabi accent in 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actor Aamir Khan said, "If I spoke perfect Punjabi, others might not understand, even if you do."
