"It would be better if you can judge these aspects after watching the film," added Aamir. Actress Sargun Mehta had stated that Aamir could have done better with his Punjabi accent.

348.title: Turn those who want to be villains in your life into comedians: Kangana
348.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut penned a note on Instagram Stories, writing, "Those who want to be villains in your life make them comedians and it will be a good story." She further wrote, "Never see yourself from the eyes of those who fail to appreciate you...Use their criticism to grow and...don't forget to rub it in their faces and have fun."

349.title: I won't rest till I get a gold medal: CWG silver medallist Tulika
349.article_body: Judoka Tulika Maan, who won a silver medal at CWG 2022, said she won't rest till she wins a gold medal. "I didn't come here to win a silver medal," she added. "When the probables were decided a year ago, Tulika wasn't...picked. She [reduced] her weight...to 85 kg from 115 kg," said coach Jiwan Sharma, who accompanied the judo contingent.

350.title: U'khand govt to develop a Sanskrit-speaking village in each district
350.article_body: The Uttarakhand government has decided to develop one Sanskrit-speaking village in each of its 13 districts. State Sanskrit Education Minister Dhan Singh Rawat said that teachers will be sent to selected villages to teach the people how to communicate in the language and such villages will be called "Sanskrit Gram". Villagers will also be taught Vedas and Puranas, he added.

351.title: Father chops son's hand after he refuses to hand over bike keys in MP
351.article_body: A man chopped off his son's hand in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district after the son refused to hand over the keys of his bike to him. "Moti [accused] asked for the keys of the bike but Santosh [son] refused to give them. [Moti] and his brother thrashed Santosh...Moti picked up an axe...[and] chopped his left hand," Police said.

352.title: K'taka HC upholds ban on sale of firecrackers within B'luru city limits
352.article_body: Karnataka High Court has upheld the ban on the sale of firecrackers imposed by the police department within Bengaluru city limits. "In dense cities like Bangalore, that [is] plagued with ceaseless sound pollution...bursting of crackers would only add to the existing woes," Justice Krishna S Dixit observed. He further noted that fireworks in narrow lanes could cause a chain reaction.

353.title: Congress leaders including Rahul, Tharoor detained during protest over price rise
353.article_body: Congress leaders including Rahul Gandhi and Shashi Tharoor were detained during a protest against the Centre over price rise and unemployment. "All Congress MPs were marching towards Rashtrapati Bhavan to raise the issue of inflation and price rise...they aren't allowing us to go ahead from here," Gandhi said. Section 144 has been imposed in New Delhi district amid the protest.

354.title: Coimbatore post offices begin selling National Flag
354.article_body: Post offices in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore are selling the National Flag as part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign ahead of the 75th Independence Day. PM Narendra Modi on July 31 urged everyone to turn the campaign into a mass movement by hoisting the National Flag at their homes. Citizens can also buy the National Flag online through e-portal service.

355.title: Akshay cries after sister's message, says 'Lives changed after this goddess'
355.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar was left in tears while on a reality show after listening to his sister's message. "We used to live in a small house. After the arrival of this goddess, our lives changed. There is no bigger relationship than that with a sister," he said. "You stood beside me at all times, good and bad," his sister said.

356.title: American singer Ne-Yo's wife files for divorce, says 'he had kid with another woman'
356.article_body: Ne-Yo's wife Crystal Renay Smith has reportedly filed for divorce from the American singer, claiming that he recently fathered a child with another woman. Renay, who married Ne-Yo in February 2016, filed divorce documents earlier this week in Atlanta saying the couple's marriage is "irretrievably broken with no hope for reconciliation". Renay and Ne-Yo have three children together.

357.title: Centre misusing central agencies to suppress Opposition: Baghel
357.article_body: Talking about National Herald case, Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel criticised Centre for its "dictatorial attitude" and alleged that the government is misusing central agencies to "suppress" the Opposition. "A dictatorial attitude has been adopted. We respect all the...agencies, but the way they are acting is unfortunate. It's being used to crush, suppress the Opposition," said Baghel.

358.title: Kishore Kumar fans demand Bharat Ratna, home to be declared heritage site
358.article_body: Several fan groups of late actor-singer Kishore Kumar have demanded a posthumous Bharat Ratna for him. They have also asked for Kishore's ancestral home in Madhya Pradesh's Khandwa to be declared a heritage site. Kishore Prerna Manch President Ranveer Singh Chawal has stated that over 2,000 postcards have been sent to the Prime Minister's Office with the demands.

359.title: Piped cooking gas price hiked by ₹2.63 per unit in Delhi, 2nd hike in 2 weeks
359.article_body: The price of piped cooking gas in Delhi has been hiked by ₹2.63 per unit due to the rise in input costs, Indraprastha Gas Limited said. The piped gas was priced at ₹47.96 per standard cubic meter (SCM). It will now cost ₹50.59 per SCM. Notably, this is the second hike in the price in less than two weeks.

360.title: French PM announces creation of new LGBTQ ambassador job
360.article_body: French PM Elisabeth Borne on Thursday said that the country will create an ambassador's post to promote LGBTQ rights worldwide. The LGBTQ envoy will coordinate the Foreign Ministry's policy, act as "France's voice" and will "campaign for the decriminalisation everywhere of homosexuality and trans identity", Borne added. The ambassador will be appointed by the end of the year.

361.title: Finance Minister has zero understanding of India's economic situation: Rahul
361.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday said that he thinks Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has "zero understanding" of what is going on in the economy of India. Rahul said this while addressing a press conference in Delhi. "I think the macroeconomic fundamentals that she is talking about is something else...[Sitharaman] is there as a mouthpiece," he added.

362.title: 16 lakh+ Delhi vehicle owners may face jail or penalty over invalid PUC
362.article_body: According to reports, if vehicles without valid PUC are caught plying on Delhi roads, owners may face imprisonment of up to six months or  fine of up to ₹10,000 or both as per Motor Vehicle Act. About 13 lakh two-wheelers and three lakh cars were plying in Delhi without valid Pollution Under Control certificate as of July 18, reports said.

363.title: It's a network, all should be arrested: BJP leader on WB SSC scam
363.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar on Thursday held a protest with other party members against the TMC-led state government over the SSC recruitment scam. Majumdar said the corruption that had happened was not possible by one person. "It's a network...all those involved should be arrested," he added. Last month, ex-West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee was arrested in the case.

364.title: Adani Enterprises' Q1 profit rises 76% to ₹469 cr, revenue up 223%
364.article_body: Adani Enterprises Limited (AEL) on Thursday reported a 76.48% rise in consolidated profit at ₹468.74 crore for the quarter ended June as against  ₹265.60 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Its consolidated revenue from operations in Q1 increased by 223% to ₹41,066.43 crore. Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani said that the group intends to leverage AEL's incubation strategy model.

365.title: She's worthy: Hemsworth as fan says 'Time for Thor to give up hammer' after Mirabai's gold
365.article_body: Actor Chris Hemsworth, who plays Thor in the Marvel movies, responded to an Indian fan over his tweet on Indian weightlifter Saikhom Mirabai Chanu's gold medal at CWG 2022. Referring to Mirabai's gold, the fan tagged Hemsworth and tweeted, "Time for Thor to give up his hammer." Hemsworth responded by writing, "She is worthy! Congrats, Saikhom, you legend!"

366.title: 5 dead, 10 injured as tempo hits car and falls into deep gorge in J&K
366.article_body: At least five persons were killed and 10 others were injured on Thursday as a tempo they were travelling in hit a car and fell into a deep gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban, police said. The vehicle was on its way to Jammu from Banihal, police added. The accident took place after the tempo's brakes failed, police stated.

367.title: Crude oil might see 10% weekly collapse as demand hit: Report
367.article_body: Oil is heading towards a 10% weekly loss as the demand for crude oil was hit by an economic slowdown globally, a Bloomberg report said. The West Texas Intermediate (WTI) was below $89/barrel in Asia, with the US benchmark down over 10% this week. According to official data, crude stockpiles increased even as gasoline consumption decreased in the US.

368.title: Women banned from appearing in ads in Iran over ad showing woman biting ice cream
368.article_body: Iran's Ministry of Culture and Islamic Guidance has banned women from appearing in adverts under the country's strict rules. The announcement came after a commercial featuring a woman biting an ice cream. Iranian officials ruled that the advertisement went "against public decency" and was an "insult" to "women's values".

369.title: India grappling with the problem of high inflation: RBI Governor
369.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that India is grappling with the problem of high inflation. "Indian economy has naturally been impacted by the global economic situation," the Governor said, adding that the globalisation of inflation is coinciding with de-globalisation of trade. "Nevertheless...India is expected to be amongst the fastest growing economies during 2022-23," he said, citing the IMF.

370.title: People are surprised that Masaba & I call each other 2-3 times a day: Neena
370.article_body: Veteran actress Neena Gupta has revealed that she and her daughter designer Masaba don't live together but keep calling each other. "So many people express surprise when they come to know that we call each other up two-three times a day," she added. Neena further said that she gets to know whatever is trending due to her daughter Masaba.

371.title: She was 12-yr-old on 'Andaz...' sets, came with Karisma: Aamir on Kareena
371.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said that his first impression of actress Kareena Kapoor Khan was a "really cute 12-year-old girl who was sitting on the sets of 'Andaz Apna Apna'". "She used to come with Lolo [Karisma Kapoor]," Aamir added, while answering a question during his time of 'Koffee With Karan 7'.

372.title: Speeding truck hits school bus from behind in UP; over 24 kids hurt
372.article_body: Over 24 children were injured, including five who sustained serious injuries, after a speeding dumper truck rammed into a school bus as it stopped to pick up a student in Uttar Pradesh's Pratapgarh on Thursday. Due to the collision, the school bus also hit a tree on the roadside. The school bus driver was also injured in the incident.

373.title: ISRO's smallest rocket to launch satellite built by 750 school girls on Aug 7
373.article_body: ISRO will be launching its smallest commercial rocket, Small Satellite Launch Vehicle (SSLV), on August 7. The SSLV will carry a satellite, AzaadiSAT, comprising 75 payloads built by 750 girl students from 75 rural government schools across India. The project is part of the Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav celebrations, to mark the 75th Independence Day year celebrations.

374.title: Loss vs Pak in T20 WC 2021 caused Team India a 'lot' of damage: Latif
374.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said India's defeat against Pakistan by 10 wickets in T20 World Cup 2021 caused the former a "lot of damage", which they are trying to recover from. "They are taking it series by series...Teams are changing with every series," added Latif. Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar earlier said Pakistan will beat India in T20 World Cup 2022.

375.title: Hyd Customs seize cigarettes, protein powder worth ₹1.15 cr; 14 arrested
375.article_body: Hyderabad Customs on Thursday arrested 14 people for trying to smuggle cigarettes and protein powder into the country. The passengers, who arrived from different flights, were found carrying 150 bottles of protein powder, 4,792 e-cigarettes and over two lakh cigarettes, all worth ₹1.15 crore, Hyderabad Customs tweeted. Last month, officials seized cigarettes worth ₹50 lakh at Hyderabad Airport.

376.title: Pune ACB books PCMC surveyor for demanding bribe of ₹3 lakh
376.article_body: The Pune unit of the Maharashtra Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has booked a surveyor of the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹3 lakh from a private company's employee. The accused had reportedly demanded the bribe to give a "development opinion" in favour of the company's development plan. The ACB verified the complaint multiple times.

377.title: New batch of IIM-I's online Exec PG Diploma starts Aug 13: Unext Jigsaw
377.article_body: IIM Indore & UNext Jigsaw announced that the last few seats are remaining for their online PGDP in Management & AI designed for professionals with 3+ years of work experience. Through the 15-month program, learners can gain Executive alumni status, network with MDs & VPs of top corporate firms, and experience week-long campus immersion with other campus benefits, Jigsaw added.

378.title: India witnessing death of democracy, onset of dictatorship: Rahul Gandhi
378.article_body: Rahul Gandhi on Friday said that India is witnessing the "death of democracy" and "onset of dictatorship". "Anybody who stands against this idea is viciously attacked, put in jail, arrested and beaten up," he added. "What India has built brick by brick, starting almost a century ago, is basically being destroyed in front of your eyes," Gandhi further said.

379.title: Gave 1st screen test in 22 yrs as Aamir wasn't confident: Kareena on 'Laal...'
379.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor said she gave her first screen test in 22 years for her role in 'Laal Singh Chaddha' as Aamir Khan wasn't confident. "Aamir was very sure that I had to screen test...It was actually [my husband] Saif Ali Khan who told me...listen...it's really cool because only Aamir...can actually tell someone...that you have to screen test," she added.

380.title: Centre will take all accounts of Congress' wrongdoings: Haryana CM
380.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar defended ED's action against the Congress leaders in the National Herald case and claimed that Centre will take all accounts of Congress' wrongdoings. The CM said, "Congress has already looted Haryana. We are going to take all the accounts of this loot from them in Delhi as well as in Haryana."

381.title: Narendra Modi is best PM ever: Kuldeep Bishnoi after joining BJP
381.article_body: After joining the BJP along with his wife and former MLA Renuka Bishnoi on Thursday, former Haryana MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi told reporters that it would not be wrong to describe PM Narendra Modi as "India's best PM". "I and my associates had been part of...[BJP's] campaign in 2014 Lok Sabha polls when Narendra Modi became the PM," he said.

382.title: Amnesty accuses Ukraine of 'putting civilians at risk', Zelenskyy responds
382.article_body: Ukrainian forces are violating the laws of war and endangering civilians by establishing bases in residential areas, including in hospitals, Amnesty International said in a report. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy condemned the report and said Amnesty International had tried to "amnesty the terrorist state and shift the responsibility from the aggressor [Russia] to the victim [Ukraine]".

383.title: BJP is horrified, is it going to declare Shah as Guj CM face: Kejriwal
383.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal said that the Bharatiya Janata Party is "horrified" because "AAP is growing rapidly in Gujarat". "Is it true that the BJP is going to declare Amit Shah ji as the chief ministerial face in the Gujarat Assembly polls? Is the BJP also angry with Bhupendra bhai Patel's work?" he asked.

384.title: 'Horrible raj': Congress MP after ED questions Kharge
384.article_body: Congress MP KC Venugopal criticised the Centre after the Enforcement Directorate (ED) questioned senior party leader Mallikarjun Kharge in connection with the National Herald case. "Horrible raj is going on in the country. There are parliamentary systems. We are law-abiding citizens...Privilege for Members of Parliament exists for the safeguarding of democracy," said Venugopal.

385.title: Pic of long jumper Sreeshankar's foul by 1 cm at CWG goes viral, fans say 'Robbed of gold'
385.article_body: A picture of Indian long jumper Murali Sreeshankar's foul at CWG 2022 has gone viral. In his fourth attempt, Sreeshankar seemingly crossed the 8-metre mark, however, his jump was declared invalid as he was adjudged to have overstepped the take-off board by 1 cm. "Robbed of gold medal," a fan tweeted. "How can that be a foul?" wrote another.

386.title: Why didn't India's Sreeshankar get gold despite having joint-best jump in CWG 2022 final?
386.article_body: India's Murali Sreeshankar won silver medal in the men's long jump event at CWG 2022 despite having the joint-best jump. Sreeshankar had a best jump of 8.08 metres, the same as gold medallist LaQuan Nairn of Bahamas. Nairn bagged the gold medal as on countback, his second-best jump of 7.98 metres was 14 cm better than Sreeshankar's 7.84 metres.

387.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read as India clinch 20 medals?
387.article_body: After the conclusion of Day 7, India's medal tally at CWG 2022 has reached 20. With six gold medals, seven silver medals and seven bronze medals, India are placed seventh on the medal standings. Scotland, who have bagged seven gold medals and a total of 34 medals, are placed fifth. Meanwhile, South Africa are placed sixth on the table.

388.title: India's real GDP growth projection for 2022-23 retained at 7.2%: RBI
388.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das, while announcing the central bank's monetary policy decision, said that India's real GDP growth projection for 2022-23 has been retained at 7.2%. The RBI also retained its retail inflation forecast for the current financial year at 6.7%. Retail inflation has remained above the RBI's upper band of 2%-6% tolerance range for the last six consecutive months.

389.title: Jharkhand High Court bans promotions of state government employees
389.article_body: Jharkhand High Court has put a ban on all promotions of state government employees. HC was hearing a plea regarding the June 23 order of the Director General of Police on granting promotions to Assistant Sub-Inspectors (ASIs) to the post of Sub-Inspectors (SIs). DGP's order stated that reserved category ASIs can seek promotion in the general category, the petitioner claimed.

390.title: Sonam shares pic of her swollen feet, says 'pregnancy is not pretty sometimes'
390.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor shared a picture of her swollen feet on Instagram and wrote, "Pregnancy is not pretty sometimes." The actress is expecting her first child with husband Anand Ahuja. Sonam, who announced her pregnancy in March, had hosted a baby shower in London. Sonam and Anand got married in May 2018.

391.title: Quite surprised, don't know the reason: R Sridhar on Suryakumar opening
391.article_body: Ex-India fielding coach R Sridhar said he was "quite surprised" to see Suryakumar Yadav open during the T20I series against West Indies, adding he really doesn't know the reason behind this decision. "There is something happening...which we're not aware about," he stated. Sridhar said he immediately checked whether Rishabh Pant was playing on seeing Suryakumar open in the first T20I.

392.title: Modi govt keen to cut short Monsoon Session: TMC's Derek O'Brien
392.article_body: TMC leader Derek O'Brien on Thursday said, "Why is Narendra Modi government running away from Parliament?" "The talk on Parliament Street is that the government is keen to cut short the Monsoon Session and end it on August 8, instead of August 12. Bad," O'Brien tweeted. Last year, all three sessions of the Parliament were curtailed due to various reasons.

393.title: Paytm payments down for many users, company says 'Working on the issue'
393.article_body: Several users have been unable to access Paytm payments on Friday as the app is facing an outage. Users reported they were being logged out suddenly and have been unable to log back in. Outage detection website DownDetector also confirmed the issue on the app. Meanwhile, Paytm tweeted, "We are already working on fixing the issue at the earliest."

394.title: Even getting here is huge: Helly on 'Zibah' qualifying for Oscar nomination
394.article_body: Speaking about her film 'Zibah' qualifying for getting nominated for Oscars, actress Helly Shah said that it's big news. "Sirf yaha tak pohchna hi badi baat hai humare liye (Even getting here is a huge deal for us)," she added. Helly had recently announced that 'Zibah' is among the top three Indian films to get a theatrical screening in LA.

395.title: Congress to protest outside Raj Bhavan in Himachal Pradesh
395.article_body: Congress will hold a demonstration outside Raj Bhavan in Himachal Pradesh on Friday as part of its nationwide campaign against rising inflation and unemployment. "The entire country is suffering due to inflation...Congress is on the streets against the anti-people policies of the BJP government. The [Centre] is misusing institutions...to suppress the Opposition," said Congress leader Alka Lamba.

396.title: Protesting villagers don't let SDM leave office for 6 hrs in Punjab
396.article_body: Residents of Lehal Khurd village in Punjab on Thursday gheraoed Lehra Sub-Divisional Magistrate's (SDM) office and didn't let the SDM leave the office for around six hours in a protest. The villagers demanded that two additional teachers' posts should be created in a primary school. The SDM said that a senior official has been informed about the protesters' demand.

397.title: You will be missed: Hrithik condoles demise of Mithilesh Chaturvedi
397.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan took to Twitter to condole the demise of veteran actor Mithilesh Chaturvedi. He wrote, "Thoughts & prayers for Mithilesh Chaturvedi Sir, a veteran actor who I've had the pleasure of working with multiple times. You will be missed. RIP." The two had worked together in 2003 film 'Koi... Mil Gaya' and 2006 film 'Krrish'.

398.title: India reports 20,551 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,35,364
398.article_body: India has reported 20,551 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 19,893 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,35,364, while the death toll has risen to 5,26,600, according to the latest data.

399.title: Internal communication not material: Zomato on multiple CEOs & 'Eternal' restructuring
399.article_body: Regarding the company moving to a multiple CEO structure and rebranding itself 'Eternal' internally, Zomato told the BSE that it had not shared its CEO Deepinder Goyal's "internal communication" with the media. It said, "The internal communication is not material and does not mandate any disclosure." Their response came after SEBI sought clarification from Zomato regarding this restructuring.

400.title: RBI hikes repo rate by 50 bps to 5.40% in its third hike in 4 months
400.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das has announced that the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has decided to increase the repo rate by 50 bps to 5.40% with immediate effect. This is the third hike in the repo rate announced by the RBI since May. With the 50 bps hike, the interest rates will rise to pre-pandemic levels.
